description: Pussytoes (Antennaria dioica) is an amazing plant species. Its small, compact leaves and flowers make it look like its namesake - a furry cat paw. Its ovate leaves are evergreen and hairy, and its tiny yellow or white blooms form in clusters during the summer months. Pussytoes can thrive in a variety of climates and soil types, and can usually be found in fields and meadows. Its bright colors and capacity to flourish in harsh climates make it an ideal plant for any garden. Pussytoes add a touch of beauty to any garden, making it a great addition for novice and experienced gardeners alike!
